instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-4924 Beep RAM
threads.message:
I did reballing the 4 memories, in the tests it worked normally, but after almost a day the mac turned off and presented a memory beep.
. Tell me it's not CPU. :(


Voltage: L7430 0V.

threads.title: 820-4924 Beep RAM
threads.message:
"Voltage: L7430 0V"
Solve this first.
Short, or low value to ground at L7430?

threads.title: 820-4924 Beep RAM
threads.message:
Seems that you do not understand the difference between diode mode and voltage range of multimeter.
0.133 on diode mode is correct value.

Post U7400 voltages; pins 12, 16, 17, 6.

threads.title: 820-4924 Beep RAM
threads.message: Replaced the u7400 and q7430, checked the R7425/C are ok, I imagine CPU is the defect ?

threads.title: 820-4924 Beep RAM
threads.message:
"12    PP5V_S3 0v"
Do you really get beep error without voltage at L7520???

threads.title: 820-4924 Beep RAM
threads.message:
It was measuring with the board out of the housing, it was giving 0V in the L7430, now I measured in the coil is giving 1.2V.
I imagine it is CPU, because I made reball Memories ?

threads.title: 820-4924 Beep RAM
threads.message: Coukd be CPU issue, or bad solders at RAM chips.
